intro: Corydalis triternata, commonly known as the three-part corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features trifoliate leaves with three oval-shaped leaflets. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported analgesic properties. Corydalis triternata thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
